reviews.review:
This film is better than The Last Jedi, but cannot redeem the Sequel Trilogy.
It tries to retcon a lot of The Last Jedi, to try and appease the fans, but at the same time these turnarounds feel very forced and out of place making an even greater mess of this weird trilogy.
It is a convoluted mess that doesn't have a beginning, a middle and an end, the whole film is just one big third act and roller coaster ride that doesn't want to end, while at the same time being overflown with exposition necessary to tie things together and explain what all of this is supposed to mean. It is just a needless MacGuffin chase that serves to establish who these characters actually are, because none of the previous films have done so.
The film is very entertaining, but you cannot take it seriously. I laughed at the first sentence of the opening crawl. People asked me to quiet down, but by the last twenty minutes of the film, we were all laughing at the ridiculous choices they made at the end and unlike with previous films, audience members were leaving as soon as the title crawl appeared and they all had grim and disappointed faces. One of our movie brigade actually fell asleep during the final battle. I would not recommend seeing this film, but it is entertaining and better than The Last Jedi. There were also some cool nods to other series and previous lore from the Expanded Universe. I will also say that I didn't feel it entirely ruined the ending of Return of the Jedi for me, just because old man Palpatine is back, but in the context of this film the Original Trilogy now really feels like this dated middle trilogy that was kind of just a buffer between the prequels and the sequels, while at the same time, the prequels are almost completely ignored. I really feel like Disney Lucasfilm just tried to bury all of the George Lucas stuff with this film and end it all so they can start fresh. But for me the film is not even remotely able to redeem the Disney Trilogy. That ship has sailed and I now consider all of this new stuff fan fiction.
A lack of imagination in the creation of the film with a few pieces of nostalgia to try and please the fans
Extremely disappointing and boring.  Beautiful visuals with zero emotional connection behind them.  A sad ending to what could have been such an epic story.

JJ tried. He really did. But he failed miserably. At its best the movie shows us that someone was paying attention to the legends material and some rather neat concepts of the force. But unfortunately most of the time it's just a whole mess of a movie and at its worst just a bad one as well. I really hoped that I would at least enjoy this movie a little bit. This aint it chief. I am sad now ðŸ˜¢
Ignore the critics and the moaners! If you like Star Wars youâ€™ll love this. Itâ€™s easily the best one of the recent trilogy! It has EVERYTHING. Canâ€™t wait to watch it again!!!

In short a total demolition of the 6 Lucas movies that actually made any sense to a cohesive story. This movie had the bag of spanners TLJ provided to fix, but the fact that yet again every character explained every plot point and Knew every answer every time it's just fundamentally poor story telling. Dreadful pacing made for a rushed movie and devastatingly weak ending to a story developed over 6.5 chapters. The other .5 of TFA was ripped off from ANH!
Rey still very OP, but an internal struggle and showing of weakness made her a more loveable character. Hit all the things the disgusting rian Johnson failed to hit. Could have had longer combat.
Eloquent but selfish critics abound. Has a movie franchise aimed at entertaining children ever delivered better, I think not.

Better than Last Jedi... but that isn't saying much.

Seems to be an attempt to patchwork the plot and just end the story as neatly as possible.  Not very lively for me, there was no "wow" moments for me.  The movie takes no risks, and offers nothing really new to the series.  

I had hoped that J.J. would find a way to mop up Rian Johnson's mess... and I can tell he tried his best with the tools he had... but it just didn't meet the mark.  I blame the failings of this movie more on Johnson than on J.J. but in the end both are complicit are lowering the standards of storytelling in the Star Wars universe.
